video:video.video:title: Woah, I Can Test Edge & IE on a Mac & Linux!
video:video.video:description: OS X and Linux are two very popular operating system choices for web developers but they still want to be able to test Internet Explorer and the new Microsoft Edge browsers. In this talk, we'll&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Microsoft Edge and IE11 for IT Professionals
video:video.video:description: In Windows 10, we will provide solutions for interoperability with the modern Web and compatibility with legacy Web technologies. In this talk we'll explore how we're making it easy for customers&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Whats new in the F12 Developer Tools
video:video.video:description: Debugging and diagnosing your Web apps just gets better with the updated F12 Developer Tools in Microsoft Edge and Internet Explorer 11. Join us for a whirlwind tour of enhancements in our in-browser&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Unleash 3D rendering with WebGL and Microsoft Edge
video:video.video:description: With the raw power delivered by WebGL, 3D on the web is now a viable option. During this session we will see how to start using WebGL from scratch. Then, using Babylon.js, we will discover how to&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Hosted web apps and web platform innovations
video:video.video:description: Bring your website experience into the Windows Store on top of the new web rendering engine. Leverage your web workflows to develop and deploy code on your server and access native Windows APIs. Learn&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Falling in love with forms
video:video.video:description: In this session, we will explore forms from top to bottom, examining how they work and how their components can be incorporated with other elements to maximize accessibility, improve semantics, and&#8230;

video:video.video:title: EcmaScript 6 - Features By Testing
video:video.video:description: ES6 (aka ES2015) offers many new and exciting features, from expressive syntax, to new powerful built-in APIs, to entirely new-to-JS programming paradigms. We'll start by quickly reviewing some of the&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Advancing JavaScript without breaking the web
video:video.video:description: One of the things Microsoft Edge is leading at is ES6 support. This is a very important part for JavaScript as a language but it also means that we're running the danger of breaking backwards&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Chakra: The JavaScript Engine that powers Microsoft Edge
video:video.video:description: This talk will cover the architectural changes we've made to the Chakra JavaScript engine in order to improve our agility and interoperability, performance enhancements that make your code run&#8230;

video:video.video:title: On the Edge with SVG
video:video.video:description: SVG has evolved a lot since it was first introduced and is still evolving with new features being introduced to both the SVG specification and CSS to advance the state of the art with SVG. In this&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Microsoft Edge: Product And Personality
video:video.video:description: Microsoft Edge is designed to work the way you do, with cool features that let you do more right in the browser. We're designing the best browser for capturing your thoughts, reading and helping you&#8230;

video:video.video:title: The Microsoft Edge Rendering Engine that makes the Web just work
video:video.video:description: We've made literally thousands of changes to jettison the legacy of the past and to dramatically improve support for the web of today and tomorrow. Come and learn about the new capabilities available&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Microsoft Edge: Introducing the new browser and rendering engine for Windows 10
video:video.video:description: Microsoft Edge will be the new browser across all Windows 10 devices, from phones to tablets, PCs and beyond. This session will provide a fast moving tour of the new browser features and peer inside&#8230;
